page.title: 16Blandford Camp,Near Pimperne
page.content: Near Pimperne is Blandford Camp, one of two major Signals Camps in the country. In l9l4 it was a naval camp and became an army camp in l939. Now there are about 2,000 people who live and work on the Camp. There are shops, a Church, a bank, a Post Office and a First School called Downlands. Soldiers are highly trained to provide communications for the British Army worldwide. They have facilities for sports, pitches, a gymnasium, and an assault course. They have a cinema, social clubs called messes, dances, lectures. The Corps band plays concerts at home and abroad and parades through Blandford with soldiers with fixed bayonets because they have the freedom of Blandford. The Corps of Signals badge has Mercury, the Royal Crown and the words Certa Cito meaning swift and sure.
